title: Patriots legend Vince Wilfork can’t wait for Bill Belichick, Robert Kraft to end their ‘beef’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "It'll get to a point where they get it squashed and we'll be able to move forward and celebrate it how we should.
" Bill Belichick has landed plenty of punches against Robert Kraft since the duo went their separate ways.
John Tlumacki/Globe Staff By Conor Ryan November 19, 2025 | 6:43 AM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Red Sox reportedly ‘showing interest’ in free agent Bo Bichette
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox Bo Bichette could be a potential replacement if the Red Sox can't re-sign Alex Bregman.
Bo Bichette would be an impact bat in Boston's batting order.

(AP Photo/Brynn Anderson) By Conor Ryan November 19, 2025 | 6:36 AM 2 minutes to read One of the top dominos that has yet to fall so far this offseason for the Red Sox is whether or not Boston will be able to re-sign slugging infielder Alex Bregman.

title: Red Sox make 4 trades, cut Nathaniel Lowe on busy day for Craig Breslow
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox reshuffled portions of their bullpen on Tuesday afternoon.
Brennan Bernardino was a useful lefty arm out of the bullpen for Boston.

(AP Photo/Mark Stockwell) By Conor Ryan November 19, 2025 | 6:33 AM 4 minutes to read Craig Breslow and the Red Sox’ top brass were busy on Tuesday — with Boston overhauling a hefty portion of its roster.

title: Webster police defend violent arrest of teen, release body camera footage
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News As the teen resisted arrest, the officers tased him twice, wrestled him to the ground, and punched him multiple times.
Webster Police Department ShareSend this article to your social connections.

A small Worcester County police department is defending the actions of its officers after a chaotic video circulated on social media showing officers wrestling and punching a teenager during an arrest.

title: These are Boston’s first-ever Michelin Guide restaurants
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News For the first time in Michelin history, Boston restaurants are now on the guide.
311 Omakase was the only restaurant in Greater Boston to receive a Michelin star, though other restaurants earned Bib Gourmand or recommended status.
John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Is the dealer recommending unnecessary maintenance?
author: John Paul
bullets: How To John Paul, AAA Northeast's Car Doctor, answers a question from a reader who is questioning services being recommended by a local dealer.
The Car Doctor answers a question from a reader who is questioning services being recommended by a local dealer.

title: Report: Red Sox’ corner outfield logjam will ‘almost surely’ lead to a trade
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Red Sox "There aren't enough at-bats in the lineup for both, especially if they add another bat in free agency.
" Jarren Duran and Wilyer Abreu Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe This offseason, the Red Sox will have to take a look at their lineup and how they’ll be able to fit the pieces together.
They have talent at the corner outfield spots, but one insider believes that there won’t be enough playing time to satisfy everyone.

title: Large section of Green Line to shut for repairs for half of December
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The Green Line's downtown stops, entire E Branch, and much of the B Branch will be closed for 15 days.
The Orange Line is also affected.
A Green Line train arrives at the MBTA Park Street station in Boston.

title: At Globe Summit, Elin Hilderbrand reflects on Nantucket, Hollywood, and writing with her daughter
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Local News The bestselling "Queen of Beach Reads" joined Love Letters’ Meredith Goldstein to discuss island life, screen adaptations, and her latest novel, “The Academy.
” (From left) Globe Love Letters columnist Meredith Goldstein hosted a “Fireside Chat” with Nantucket author Elin Hilderbrand at the Globe Summit on Nov.
